page.title: 11THE COUNTRY PARK
page.content: As soon as you walk through the gate of the country park you can see, along the path which leads to the beach, a vast amount of plant life. On the east of the park you can see newly planted trees and saplings, while on the west side you can witness a good example of a{'man-made'}environment and a {'natural'}environment. The man-made is the opencast and housing estates, while the natural is the open fields, trees and bushes. Although the country park is very pleasant to look at, there are few facilities for organised activities. This is to be expected as the park is very new. No doubt, as time goes on, more facilities will be introduced.
